On 03/09/05, waldo700 <brian@...> wrote:
> 
>  I've just installed JUnit and my CLASSPATH looks like this:
> 
> PATH=C:\WINDOWS\system32;C:\WINDOWS;C:\WINDOWS\System32\Wbem;C:\Program
> Files\Java\jdk1.5.0_04\bin;C:\Program Files\Common Fi
> les\Adobe\AGL;C:\Sun\AppServer\bin;C:\JUNIT_HOME\junit3.8.1\junit.jar



Just curious, but that looks like your PATH rather than CLASSPATH? Typo?

When I attempt the tests, 
> 
> java junit.textui.TestRunner junit.samples.AllTests
> java junit.swingui.TestRunner junit.samples.AllTests
> 
> -- I get the error: 
> 
> Exception in thread "main" java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError:
> junit/textui/TestRunner
> (or swingui, as applicable)
> 
> Also, I find it odd that the src files I extracted have a subdir to
> the "junit" dir with the following: awtui, extensions, framework,
> runner, swingui, and textui. 
> 
> However, in the actual compiled "junit" dir which I downloaded, there
> are only the dirs: "samples" and "tests".
> 
> I'm probably missing something very subtle here. Can't find the exact
> guidance I need in the FAQ. (Or if it's there, I'm not seeing it.) 
> 
> Any assistance would be greatly appreciated.
> 
> Brian
> 
> I think you might be better off trying



java -cp ${path to directory containing junit/samples}:${path to junit.jar} 
junit.textui.TestRunner junit.samples.AllTests

with the relevant machine / platform-specific substitutions.

James
